feed.title: Track Awesome V Updates Daily
feed.subtitle: A curated list of awesome V frameworks, libraries, software and resources.

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Jul 03, 2025
entry.content:
Graphics

  • svgg (‚≠ê6) - V module to load and resterize svg file into gg.Image object.

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Jun 17, 2025
entry.content:
Web

  • sessions (‚≠ê6) - Web-framework-agnostic sessions library.

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Mar 11, 2025
entry.content:
Web

  • v-vite starter (‚≠ê3) - A starter kit for Veb applications, preconfigured with Vite.js.
  • vite.v (‚≠ê6) - Seamless Vite.js integration for Veb applications.

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Mar 04, 2025
entry.content:
Web

  • veb (‚≠ê37k) - V's built-in web framework.

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Feb 27, 2025
entry.content:
Build Systems

  • vab (‚≠ê334) - The official V tool to build and package applications for Android.
  • vab-sdl (‚≠ê4) - Standalone and extra command for vab to build and package SDL2 and SDL3 based applications importing vlang/sdl.

Audio

  • miniaudio (‚≠ê53) - Bindings for the excellent miniaudio C audio library.

Game development

  • chipmunk2d (‚≠ê3) - V wrapper of the Chipmunk2D physics library.
  • wren (‚≠ê7) - V wrapper around the excellent Wren scripting language.

Graphics

  • sdl (‚≠ê99) - Official SDL2 & SDL3 bindings for V.
  • sgldraw (‚≠ê10) - An experimental real-time vector render V module based on sokol.sgl.
  • voronoi (‚≠ê1) - V wrapper of JCash/voronoi (‚≠ê686).
  • vqoi (‚≠ê14) - V: QOI - The "Quite OK Image" format for fast, lossless image compression.

Interoperability

  • jni (‚≠ê28) - V wrapper around the C Java Native Interface (Desktop + Android).

entry.content:
Database clients

  • redict (‚≠ê5) - Client for Redict, a LGPL-3.0-only fork of Redis (compatible with Redis <=7.2.4).

Utility

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Aug 29, 2023
entry.content:
Interpreters/Compilers

  • cotowali (‚≠ê614) - A statically typed scripting language that transpiles into POSIX sh.

Utilities

  • emoji-mart-desktop (‚≠ê21) - An emoji picker created with V, webview and SvelteKit.

Graphics

  • vsl.vcl (‚≠ê371) - VCL is a high level way of writing programs with OpenCL using V. These are highly opinionated OpenCL bindings for V. It tries to make GPU computing easy, with some sugar abstraction, V's concurrency and channels.

User Interface toolkits

  • V-WebUI (‚≠ê128) - A wrapper for WebUI. A lightweight library that allows you to use any web browser as a GUI, with V in the backend and HTML5 in the frontend.
  • webview (‚≠ê75) - Bindings for webview. A tiny library to build modern cross-platform GUI applications. It allows to combine V with modern web technologies to design a graphical user interface.

Online IDEs with V / Vim

  • VOSCA V Playground

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on May 28, 2023
entry.content:
Command-line

  • github-releases (‚≠ê6) - Cli tool to keep track of applications released as GitHub Release (or assets in workflow) and download them.
  • portctl (‚≠ê9) - CLI tool to manage Docker Swarm resources using Portainer API.
  • vcli (‚≠ê3) - A CLI tool to generate folder structure according to the guideline
  • vgoogle (‚≠ê9) - Make google search on the terminal.
  • vindex (‚≠ê5) - A simple file list server generating json strings, compatible with nginx's autoindex module.

Graphics

  • vRayTracer (‚≠ê49) - A simple ray tracer written in V.
  • V_sokol_gp (‚≠ê4) - A V wrapper for the sokol_gp library for easy and fast 2d graphics.
  • vsdl2 (‚≠ê46) - A libSDL2 wrapper.

Interpreters/Compilers

  • stas (‚≠ê58) - A stack based compiled programming language. The bootstrap compiler is written in V.
  • v (‚≠ê37k) - V itself. Simple, fast, safe, compiled language for developing maintainable software.
  • vas (‚≠ê99) - A simple x86-64 assembler written in V.

Serialization

  • vlang-yaml (‚≠ê27) - A V-native YAML reader, incl. YAML-to-JSON converter.
  • vproto (‚≠ê56) - Protobuf compiler and runtime in V.

Web

  • v-admin-skeleton (‚≠ê14) - Backend skeleton written in V.
  • v-jsonrpc (‚≠ê35) - Basic JSON-RPC 2.0-compliant server written on V.
  • v-tiktok - A V library for downloading TikTok videos.

Game development

  • vraylib (‚≠ê49) - V wrapper (bindings) for raylib, the C game development framework.

User Interface toolkits

  • V UI (‚≠ê2.4k) - Integrated cross platform UI toolkit for Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS and the web.

Editor plugins / Emacs

  • vlang-mode.el (‚≠ê13) - Emacs major mode for the V programming language.

Editor plugins / Vim

  • vim-v (‚≠ê25) - Quality syntax highlighting for the V programming language.

GitHub templates / Vim

  • v-project-basement (‚≠ê13) - A basement for every V project, that contains universal minimum GitHub CI scripts and issue templates for a V project.

Patterns / Vim

  • MVU.v (‚≠ê5) - MVU pattern (The Elm Architecture) implemented in V programming language.

Programming contests / Vim

  • Advent of Code 2022 (‚≠ê45) - Solution of Advent of Code 2022 in V.

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Oct 30, 2022
entry.content:
Editors

  • vPDF (‚≠ê85) - A module to simplify PDF file creation using the V programming language.

Web

  • Gitly (‚≠ê1.4k) - A light and fast SCM alternative to GitHub/GitLab written in V.

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Oct 28, 2022
entry.content:
Command-line

  • crepl (‚≠ê32) - Compile and execute C code on the fly as you type it.

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Oct 10, 2022
entry.content:
Serialization

  • vgura (‚≠ê21) - Official Gura parser for V.

Scientific computing

  • vsl (‚≠ê371) - VSL is a Scientific Library with a great variety of different modules. Although most modules offer pure-V definitions, VSL also provides modules that wrap known C libraries among other backends that allow high performance computing as an alternative. Also provides opinionated wrappers for OpenBLAS, LAPACKE, MPI, OpenCL among other libraries.
  • vtl (‚≠ê156) - The V Tensor Library is a numerical computing library supporting n-dimensional data structure, backed by VSL.

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Oct 04, 2022
entry.content:
Command-line

  • HN-top (‚≠ê23) - A simple command to list most recent news from hacker-news.
  • klonol (‚≠ê20) - CLI tool to help you "clone all" git repositories belonging to you. Works with GitHub and Gitea.
  • runner (‚≠ê27) - A tool that automates running/compiling code written in various programming languages.
  • symlinker (‚≠ê8) - A small Linux tool to manage symlinks.
  • vast (‚≠ê28) - A simple tool for vlang, generate v source file to AST json file.
  • verve (‚≠ê7) - Simple and fast static file server.
  • vinit (‚≠ê16) - A tool to generate v projects.
  • vLogQL (‚≠ê17) - A tiny command-line utility to query LogQL APIs.
  • vqrcode (‚≠ê27) - CLI for creating QR Codes.
  • vspect (‚≠ê2) - A tool to inspect vlang source file. ( Archived )

Editors

  • text_editor (‚≠ê37k) - Small text editor from the official V examples.

Games

  • Boundstone (‚≠ê61) - High Performance / Fast Compilation / Lightweight Minecraft: Bedrock Edition Server.
  • Kurarin (‚≠ê53) - osu! beatmap visualizer made in V. Example video.
  • minesweeper (‚≠ê38) - A simple Minesweeper game written in vlang.
  • v-pong (‚≠ê13) - A classic paddle game brought back to life through the power of V.

Interpreters/Compilers

  • monkey_v (‚≠ê39) - Implementation of Thorsten Ball's Monkey Language in V.
  • vbf (‚≠ê19) - A brainfuck interpreter/compiler.
  • vcc (‚≠ê104) - A C compiler written in V.
  • Vork (‚≠ê28) - Alternative V compiler/interpreter written in Python.

Operating systems/Kernels

  • Vinix (‚≠ê2k) - Small and simple OS in V. Runs bash.

Project management

  • Lenra template (‚≠ê3) - The Lenra template to write V app for Lenra platform.
  • vset (‚≠ê20) - A project setup and configuration tool for V projects.

Web

  • vblog (‚≠ê29) - A simple, fast and responsive blogging system.
  • Vebview.JS (‚≠ê81) - Electron/Neutralino.JS alternative written in V.
  • Vieter (‚≠ê11) - Archlinux repository server & package build system, written in V.
  • Vlang Benchmarks Visualization (‚≠ê9) - Fancy statistics and plots for Is V still fast?.
  • vorum (‚≠ê221) - Open-source blogging/forum software written in V.
  • vss (‚≠ê42) - Easy-to-use static site generator.
  • VTik (‚≠ê18) - TikTok and Twitter video downloader app (CLI / Telegram Bot).
  • pico.v (‚≠ê117) - A web server in V based on picoev and picohttpparser.
  • validate (‚≠ê21) - A simple library to validate strings in V.
  • valval (‚≠ê155) - Web framework written in V, improved by vweb.
  • vcurrency (‚≠ê7) - API wrapper (written in V) for https://api.exchangeratesapi.io.
  • vex (‚≠ê343) - Web framework written on V inspired by Express and Sinatra.
  • vigest (‚≠ê4) - Simple client for digest authentication (written in V).
  • vxbloauth (‚≠ê8) - A minimalistic Xbox Live authenticator for vweb.

Audio

  • vave (‚≠ê42) - A crazy simple library for reading/writing WAV files in V. üåä
  • vspeech (‚≠ê50) - Complete V bindings for Mozilla's DeepSpeech TensorFlow based Speech-to-Text library. üì¢üìú

Automation

  • vrobot (‚≠ê53) - Desktop automation for V. Only supports Windows.

Command line interface (CLI) / Terminal / Shell

  • spinners (‚≠ê20) - Create spinners in your terminal!

Database clients

  • redis (‚≠ê70) - Redis client for V, written in V.
  • vmemcached (‚≠ê11) - Memcached client for V, written in V.
  • vsql (‚≠ê46) - A sql query builder for V.

Discord

  • discord.v (‚≠ê118) - User-friendly Discord bot library.
  • viscord (‚≠ê22) - Pretty basic library for connecting to the Discord gateway.
  • vord (‚≠ê5) - Library for interacting with user account endpoints and gateway (Self-bots, custom clients, etc).

Eventing

  • eventbus (‚≠ê37k) - A simple event bus system for V.

File handling

  • v-mime (‚≠ê24) - MIME detection library for V.
  • vmon (‚≠ê37) - Asynchronously watch for file changes in a directory. The module is essentially a V wrapper for septag/dmon. It works for Windows, macOS and Linux.

Game development

  • V_ecs (‚≠ê19) - ECS library made in V inspired by Bevy ECS.

Graphics

  • V Earcut (‚≠ê14) - fast (real-time) polygon triangulation library based on mapbox/Earcut (‚≠ê2.3k) to handle holes, twisted polygons, degeneracies and self-intersections.
  • viup (‚≠ê46) - V wrapper for the C-based cross-platform UI library, IUP.
  • vsdl (‚≠ê12) - V wrapper for the C-based SDL library.

IRC

  • vitric (‚≠ê4) - A transparent IRC library.

Networking

  • vmq (‚≠ê21) - V wrapper For ZMQ (aka ZeroMQ, √òMQ, 0MQ: a high-performance asynchronous messaging library).

Operating system

  • vlipboard (‚≠ê12) - An easy to use wrapper of clipboard with Wayland and Termux support.

Scientific computing

  • vplot (‚≠ê16) - V wrapper for GNU Plot (gnuplot_i).

Serial Communications

  • vi2c (‚≠ê14) - A tiny (wrapper) library for I2C serial communication for Linux written in V.

Telecommunications

  • vagi (‚≠ê7) - Asterisk FastAGI library in V.

Text processing

  • ascii_robot (‚≠ê14) - ASCII Robot generator written in V.
  • chalk (‚≠ê22) - Colorize strings in the terminal.
  • cjson (‚≠ê12) - Wrap cJSON for vlang.
  • crayon (‚≠ê58) - Paint your terminal output like Picasso. üñçÔ∏èüé®
  • iconv (‚≠ê7) - Wrap iconv for vlang.
  • Rosie-RPL (‚≠ê6) - A Rosie Pattern Language (RPL) implementation.
  • v-regex (‚≠ê14) - A simple regex library for V.

User Interface toolkits

  • mui (‚≠ê113) - A Cross-Platform UI library for Windows, Linux, Android and Web.

Utility

  • range (‚≠ê33) - Functionality of Python's range() in V.
  • vdotenv (‚≠ê40) - Support for .env files which loads environment variables.

Articles

  • An introduction to V

Books

  • Getting Started with V Programming - Navule Pavan Kumar Rao - Packt 2021 Dec - Introductory book on V.

Communities

  • V Community

Editor plugins / Sublime Text 3

  • sublime-v (‚≠ê15) - Fully-featured Sublime Text 3 package for the V Programming Language.

Editor plugins / Vim

  • vim-vtools (‚≠ê17) - V tools for Vim, including auto formatting.

Forums / Vim

  • r/vlang
  • Stack Overflow

GitHub actions / Vim

  • action-create-v-docs - GitHub action to create documentation for V modules.
  • setup-v - GitHub action to install and use V in your workflow.

Operating Systems & OS Development Examples / Vim

  • Simple Linux kernel module example (‚≠ê27) - Demonstration & test of writing a very simple Linux kernel module, using V.

Programming contests / Vim

  • Advent of Code 2019 (‚≠ê12) - Solution of Advent of Code 2019 in V.
  • SoloLearn Coding Challenges (‚≠ê16) - Implementation of the SoloLearn coding challenges in V.

Syntax highlighting / Vim

  • kate-syntax-highlight-v (‚≠ê21) - V syntax highlighting for Kate.
  • scite-v-support (‚≠ê2) - V syntax highlighting for SciTE.

Tutorials / Vim

  • Learn V in Y Minutes (‚≠ê62)
  • V by Example (‚≠ê172) - V book as GitBook.
  • V for Node Devs (‚≠ê28) - Vlang for node js developers.
  • V learning notes (‚≠ê175) - Personal learning notes in Chinese.

Videos / Vim

  • The V Programming Language
  • V Programming Tutorials

entry.title: Awesome V Updates on Nov 11, 2021
entry.content:
Command line interface (CLI) / Terminal / Shell

  • vesseract (‚≠ê17) - V wrapper for Tesseract-OCR (optical character recognition).

Game development

  • engine (‚≠ê45) - WIP Vulkan in V.

entry.content:
Command line interface (CLI) / Terminal / Shell

  • progressbar (‚≠ê29) - An easy to use V library for creating progress bars in cli.
  • termtable (‚≠ê46) - V Terminal Tables: Simple and highly customizable library to display tables in the terminal.
  • vargs (‚≠ê38) - V library for parsing arguments from argv-like arrays. ( Archived )
